name: PhysIO_Tapas
description: Tapas Physio: Physiological noise correction for fMRI
author: Lars Kasper, Zurich University and ETH Zurich

inputs.description: Input folder for physiological, fMRI and other data.
inputs.name: Input folder

inputs.description: Runs Correct noise
inputs.name: Correct noise

inputs.description: The results are saved to folder obtained by adding this prefix to the input folder name
inputs.name: Output folder prefix
Logfile Vendor
inputs.description: Vendor name depending on your MRI scanner/Physiological recording system.

inputs.name: Cardiac Logfile
inputs.description:
Logfile with cardiac, i.e. ECG/PPU (pulse oximetry) data.
Select 0 files if only respiratory data is available.
For Philips and BIDS, same as respiratory logfile.

inputs.name: Respiration Logfile
inputs.description: Logfile with respiratory, i.e. breathing belt amplitude data.

inputs.name: Relative Start Acquisition
inputs.description:
Time (in seconds) when the 1st scan (or, if existing, dummy) started, relative to the start of the logfile recording:
[] (empty) to read from explicit acquisition timing info
0 if simultaneous start
10, if 1st scan starts 10 seconds AFTER physiological recording
-20, if first scan started 20 seconds BEFORE phys recording

inputs.name: Align Scan
inputs.description:
Determines which scan shall be aligned to which part of the logfile.
Typically, aligning the last scan to the end of the logfile is beneficial, since the start of the logfile and scans might be shifted due to pre-scans.

inputs.name: Scan Timing
inputs.description: Additional file for relative timing information between logfiles and MRI scans.

inputs.name: Sampling Interval
inputs.description: Sampling interval of phys log files (in seconds).

inputs.name: Number of Slices
inputs.description: Number of slices in one volume.

inputs.name: Number of Slices Per Beat
inputs.description:
Only for triggered (gated) sequences:
Number of slices acquired per heartbeat

inputs.name: TR
inputs.description: Repetition time (in seconds) between consecutive image volumes.

inputs.name: Number of Dummies
inputs.description: Number of dummies that were acquired (but will not show up in design matrix).

inputs.name: Number of scans
inputs.description: Number of scans (volumes) in design matrix.

inputs.name: Onset Slice
inputs.description:
Slice to which regressors are temporally aligned.
Typically the slice where your most important activation is expected.

inputs.name: Time Slice-to-Slice
inputs.description:
Duration between acquisition of two different slices.
If empty, set to default value (TR/Nslices).

inputs.name: Number of Preparation Pulses
inputs.description:
Count of preparation pulses BEFORE 1st dummy scan.
Only important if Align Scan = 'first', since then preparation pulses and dummy triggers are counted and discarded as first scan onset.

inputs.name: Sync Method
inputs.description: Determines scan timing from nominal scan parameters or logged gradient time courses.

inputs.name: Gradient Direction
inputs.description: Must choose x,y, or z.

inputs.name: Gradient Zero
inputs.description: Gradient amplitude threshold below which values will be set to zero.

inputs.name: Gradient Slice
inputs.description: Gradient amplitude threshold for start of new slice.

inputs.name: Gradient Volume
inputs.description:
Gradient amplitude threshold for start of new volume.
Optional parameter - can be used if volume start indicated by higher gradient amplitude.
Mutually exclusive with use of vol_spacing parameter.

inputs.name: Gradient Volume Spacing
inputs.description:
Gradient amplitude threshold for start of new volume.
Optional parameter - can be used if volume start indicated by higher gradient amplitude.
Mutually exclusive with use of vol_spacing parameter.

inputs.name: Cardiac Modality
inputs.description: Shall ECG or PPU data be read from logfiles?

inputs.name: Filter Raw Cardiac Time Series
inputs.description: Filter properties for bandpass-filtering of cardiac signal before peak detection, phase extraction, and other physiological traces.

inputs.name: Filter Type
inputs.description:
Which infinite impulse response filter shall be used?
'Chebychev Type II (cheby2)': Chebychev Type II filter, use for steep transition from start to stop band
'Butterworth (butter)': Butterworth filter, standard filter with maximally flat passband (Infinite impulse response), but stronger ripples in transition band

inputs.name: Filter Passband
inputs.description:
[f_min, f_max] frequency interval in Hz of all frequency that should pass the passband filter.
If empty, no filtering is performed.]

inputs.name: Filter Stopband
inputs.description:
[f_min, f_max] frequency interval in Hz of all frequencies, such that frequencies outside this band should definitely NOT pass the filter.
NOTE: only relevant for 'cheby2' filter type.
If empty, and passband is empty, no fitlering is performed.
If empty, but passband exists, stopband interval is 10% increased passband interval.

inputs.name: Cardiac Pulse Selection Method
inputs.description: The initial cardiac pulse selection structure: Determines how the majority of cardiac pulses is detected in a first pass.

inputs.name: Cardiac Pulse Selection Minimum
inputs.description:
Minimum threshold for peak height in z-scored cardiac waveform to find pulse events.
NOTE: For ECG, might need increase (e.g., 2.0), because of local maximum of T wave after QRS complex.

inputs.name: Cardiac Pulse Selection File
inputs.description:
File containing reference ECG-peak (variable kRpeak),
Used for method 'manual' or 'load'.
If method == 'manual', this file is saved after picking the QRS-wave such that results are reproducible.

inputs.name: Maximum Heart Rate (BPM)
inputs.description:
Maximum expected heart rate in beats per minute.
This only needs to be a rough guess and should be changed for specific populations.

inputs.name: Post-Hoc Selection of Cardiac Pulses
inputs.description: The post-hoc cardiac pulse selection structure: if only few (<20) cardiac pulses are missing in a session due to bad signal quality, a manual selection after visual inspection is possible using the following parameters. The results are saved for reproducibility.

inputs.name: Post-Hoc Selection File
inputs.description: Filename where cardiac pulses are saved after manual picking.

inputs.name: Post-Hoc Selection Percentile
inputs.description: Percentile of beat-2-beat interval histogram that constitutes the average heart beat duration in the session.

inputs.name: Post-Hoc Selection Upper Threshold
inputs.description: Minimum exceedance (in %) from average heartbeat duration to be classified as missing heartbeat.

inputs.name: Post-Hoc Selection Lower Threshold
inputs.description: Minimum reduction (in %) from average heartbeat duration to be classified an abundant heartbeat.

inputs.name: Output File for Multiple Regressors
inputs.description:
Output file for physiological regressors.
Choose file name with extension:
.txt for ASCII files with 1 regressor per column
.mat for MATLAB variable file

inputs.name: Output Physio Structure
inputs.description:
Output file for physio-structure with extracted physiological time series, detected peak and created regressors.
Choose mat-file name; structure will be saved as variable physio in there.

inputs.name: Orthogonalise
inputs.description:
Orthogonalise physiological regressors with respect to each other.
NOTE: This is only recommended for triggered/gated acquisition sequences.

inputs.name: Censor Unreliable Recording Intervals
inputs.description: If parts of the physiological recording intervals are unreliable (e.g., constant due to belt detachment) the corresponding parts of recording-dependent RETROICOR regressors are set to 0 in the final multiple regressors file.

inputs.name: Include RETROICOR
inputs.description: Include RETROICOR Model, as described in Glover et al., MRM 2000.

inputs.name: RETROICOR Cardiac Order
inputs.description:
Order of Fourier expansion for cardiac phase.
Equals 1/2 number of cardiac regressors, since sine and cosine terms are computed.

inputs.name: RETROICOR Respiratory Order
inputs.description:
Order of Fourier expansion for respiratory phase.
Equals 1/2 number of respiratory regressors, since sine and cosine terms are computed.

inputs.name: RETROICOR Cardiac X Respiratory Order
inputs.description:
Order of Fourier expansion for interaction of cardiac and respiratory phase.
Equals 1/4 number of interaction regressors, since since and cosine terms are computed and multiplied.

inputs.name: Include Respiratory Volume per Time (RVT)
inputs.description: Respiratory Volume per Time (RVT) Model, as described in Birn et al. NeuroImage 40, 644-654.

inputs.name: RVT Delays
inputs.description: Delays (in seconds) by which respiratory response function is shifted with respect to RVT regressor before convolution.

inputs.name: Include Heart Rate Variability (HRV)
inputs.description: Heart Rate Variability (HRV) Model, as described in Chang et al., NeuroImage 44, 857-869.

inputs.name: HRV Delays
inputs.description: Delays (in seconds) by which respiratory response function is shifted with respect to HRV regressor before convolution.

inputs.name: Include Noise ROIs
inputs.description: Noise ROIs model (Principal components of anatomical regions), similar to aCompCor, Hehzadi et al. 2007.

inputs.name: Include Noise ROIs
inputs.description: Noise ROIs model (Principal components of anatomical regions), similar to aCompCor, Hehzadi et al. 2007.

inputs.name: model.noise_rois.force_coregister
inputs.description: Integer

inputs.name: model.noise_rois.n_components
inputs.description: Integer

inputs.name: model.noise_rois.n_voxel_crop
inputs.description: Integer

inputs.name: model.noise_rois.thresholds
inputs.description: real

inputs.name: model.movement.censoring_method
inputs.description: String

inputs.name: model.movement.censoring_threshold
inputs.description: interval

inputs.name: model.movement.file_realignment_parameters
inputs.description: String

inputs.name: model.movement.include
inputs.description: bool

inputs.name: model.movement.order
inputs.description: Integer

inputs.name: model.other.include
inputs.description: bool

inputs.name: ons_secs.c_scaling
inputs.description: Integer

inputs.name: ons_secs.r_scaling
inputs.description: Integer

inputs.name: verbose.close_figs
inputs.description: bool

inputs.name: verbose.fig_output_file
inputs.description: String

inputs.name: verbose.level
inputs.description: Integer

inputs.name: verbose.save_figs
inputs.description: bool

inputs.name: verbose.show_figs
inputs.description: bool

inputs.name: verbose.use_tabs
inputs.description: bool

groups.description: Specify log files where peripheral data was stored, and their properties.
groups.name: Log File Parameters

groups.description: Parameters for scan timing and synchronization.
groups.name: Scan Timing Parameters

groups.description: Thresholding parameters for de-noising and timing
groups.name: Preprocessing Paramaters

groups.description: Physiological model to be estimated and included in GLM as multiple_regressors.txt.
groups.name: Model Parameters

output-files.description: A folder containing the output files and a copy of configs.
output-files.name: Output folder
